item.title: New ransomware strains linked to North Korean govt hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Several ransomware strains have been linked to APT38, a North Korean-sponsored hacking group known for its focus on targeting and stealing funds from financial institutions worldwide. [...]

item.title: Conti, REvil, LockBit ransomware bugs exploited to block encryption
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: Hackers commonly exploit vulnerabilities in corporate networks to gain access, but a researcher has turned the table by finding exploits in the most common ransomware and malware being distributed today. [...]

item.title: New phishing warns: Your verified Twitter account may be at risk
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Phishing emails increasingly target verified Twitter accounts with emails designed to steal their account credentials, as shown by numerous ongoing campaigns conducted by threat actors. [...]

item.title: SEC ramps up fight on cryptocurrency fraud by doubling cyber unit
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) announced today that it will almost double the Crypto Assets and Cyber Unit to ramp up the fight against cryptocurrency fraud to protect investors from "cyber-related threats." [...]

item.title: Google: Chinese state hackers keep targeting Russian govt agencies
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google said today that a Chinese-sponsored hacking group linked to China's People's Liberation Army Strategic Support Force (PLA SSF) is targeting Russian government agencies. [...]

item.title: Microsoft PowerShell lets you track Windows Registry changes
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: ​A handy tip was shared online this week, showing how you can use PowerShell to monitor changes to the Windows Registry over time. [...]

item.title: Unpatched DNS bug affects millions of routers and IoT devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability in the domain name system (DNS) component of a popular C standard library that is present in a wide range of IoT products may put millions of devices at DNS poisoning attack risk. [...]

item.title: Aruba and Avaya network switches are vulnerable to RCE attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Security researchers have discovered five vulnerabilities in network equipment from Aruba (owned by HP) and Avaya (owned by ExtremeNetworks), that could allow malicious actors to execute code remotely on the devices. [...]

item.title: Chinese cyber-espionage group Moshen Dragon targets Asian telcos
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Researchers have identified a new cluster of malicious cyber activity tracked as Moshen Dragon, targeting telecommunication service providers in Central Asia. [...]

item.title: Embed Python scripts in HTML with PyScript
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The project was announced this weekend at PyCon US 2022 and acts as a wrapper around the Pyodide project, which loads the CPython interpreter as a WebAssembly browser module. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Defender for Business stand-alone now generally available
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says that its enterprise-grade endpoint security for small to medium-sized businesses is now generally available. [...]

item.title: Google SMTP relay service abused for sending phishing emails
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Phishing actors abuse Google's SMTP relay service to bypass email security products and successfully deliver malicious emails to targeted users. [...]

item.title: Cyberspies use IP cameras to deploy backdoors, steal Exchange emails
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A newly discovered and uncommonly stealthy Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group is breaching corporate networks to steal Exchange (on-premise and online) emails from employees involved in corporate transactions such as mergers and acquisitions. [...]
